attributes.action: Ban British citizens from serving in the Israeli military
attributes.background: There are currently many British citizens serving in the Israeli Defense Forces (IDF). The UK government should ban UK citizens – even if they hold other passports – from joining and serving in the Israeli military, police or other security forces.
attributes.additional_details: The Israeli military routinely commits acts which many experts believe, under international law, constitute war crimes - including occupying Palestinian territory; torturing suspects; bombing Palestinian schools, hospitals, and water plants; and conducting collective punishments of civilians - all of which are unlawful in international law. No UK citizens should be allowed to possibly contribute to further war crimes by serving in the Israeli military, police or security apparatus.

attributes.action: Abolish the House of Lords and replace it with an elected upper chamber
attributes.background:
The House of Lords is meant to be a revising chamber for Government legislation. It is currently bursting at the seams with unelected peers who claim expenses and do not vote. 115 peers claimed £1.3m in expenses but scarcely uttered a word or voted.
Replace the House with an elected upper chamber.
attributes.additional_details:
It is time for elections to the House of Lords.
Elect people from different backgrounds and experience to represent the people and truly hold Parliament to account.

attributes.action: Halt the cuts to military music.
attributes.background:
The Royal Marines, Army and Central Band of the Royal Air Force are an integral part of the the British Military.
If the cuts to military music are not halted national ceremonies such as Armistice Day will suffer removing the infrastructure and teaching process.  No further cuts to military music.
attributes.additional_details:
Bands have had a secondary role for some twenty years being trained as Medics. This was not some haphazard scheme but properly conducted by the RAMC Training school in Ash Vale and was as stringent and complex as the training given to their own trainees.

Bands did go on operations and supplied medical cover.

The scrapping of all Regimental Bands was a catastrophe and what remains of Military Music must be left in place.   

No further cuts to military music.

attributes.action: Take back control of MP salaries, reduce MP pay to UK average salary (£27k pa)
attributes.background: Take back control from IPSA and implement a new pay structure method which determines MP salaries by analysing all UK salaries and sets MP salaries at the same level as the average UK salary, which is currently around £27,000 pa (2017).
attributes.additional_details:
Travel expenses to and from work engagements should be either refunded to the MP - or - MPs should be given free travel-cards to enable them to travel to and from work engagements free from financial expense.

This isn't about punishing MPs, it's about restructuring MP salaries to better reflect the values we hold dear in Britain; values of fairness and equality. In times of financial difficulty for many citizens in the UK, we need to make changes in the government that align with reality.

attributes.action: Introduce an Electronic Voting System to stop Voting Fraud
attributes.background: Voting Fraud is happening in the UK
attributes.additional_details:
The people of the UK request that before the next General Election a new voting procedure be put into place.     The system should  have the ability to stamp out voter fraud and should be able to check for multiple voting  which is happening  in some areas of the UK.      Some form of electronic voting using your  National Insurance number or even the issuing an identify card would be ideal.  

Postal voting should only be available to the elderly and severely disabled.    

Penalties for illegal voting and multiple voting should be severe and classed as a criminal conviction, a £5,000 fine, and a ban from voting for at least 10 years.

The voting system should apply to the whole of the UK.... no exceptions

attributes.action: Introduce mandatory fluoridation of the water supply to prevent tooth decay
attributes.background: Tooth decay is almost entirely preventable, but is the most common reason why children aged 5 to 9 require hospital admission. Water fluoridation is an effective public health measure proven to reduce tooth decay. Centrally funded and mandated water fluoridation is needed to protect our oral health.
attributes.additional_details:
PHE recommends fluoridation, but cannot enforce it. It's within the remit of local authorities, many of which do not have funds to implement it. 31 to 41% of 5-year-old children have evidence of tooth decay, with higher rates in deprived populations. 

PHE research reveals:

- 15% fewer 5-year-olds with tooth decay in fluoridated areas, rising to 28% when deprivation is considered
- 45% fewer hospital admissions of children aged 1 to 4 for tooth decay in fluoridated areas

attributes.action: In 2019 hold a referendum to reinstate capital punishment
attributes.background:
It is a condition of membership of the EU that all member states do not practice capital punishment.

When we are finally free of the EU the people should be allowed a referendum to reinstate capital punishment.

attributes.action: Request the UK government in the Brexit negotiations to agree 4 specific points
attributes.background: The petition is to ask the UK Government to agree on the behalf of The British Electorate 4 specific points.
attributes.additional_details:
We the under signed, request the UK government in the Brexit negotiations to;
1). Pay the EU nothing more. 
2). On UK sovereign matters, the UK Courts to have final jurisdiction.
3). Northern Ireland to be solely a UK issue. 
4). Immigrant quotas at the sole discretion of UK Parliament, with no interference from the EU.

attributes.action: Lower the age a stillborn can legally be registered.
attributes.background: It should be the parents’ choice whether to have a birth certificate. All stillborn babies should be able to be registered if that’s what the parents want. I ask as many people as possible to sign this petition, email your MPs and raise awareness so these babies get recognition.
attributes.additional_details:
We were given the devastating news at 16 weeks that our baby girl will not survive after birth, and there is nothing we can do to save her. Nothing. I am going to lose my Little Bean.
 
We were offered a termination, but then told our little girl will never legally exist. I have chosen to carry my baby girl until 24 weeks so she gets the recognition she deserves. Every day I feel her kick and grow, knowing I am one day closer to saying goodbye. 8 long weeks.
 
It is torture, its heart breaking.

attributes.action: To upgrade all English bridleways to byways.
attributes.background:
Opening up England’s bridleways would have a fantastic impact on the UKs health and pump more money into the UK economy. 
This change is mainly aimed for the trail riding community, estimated at 10,000 people.
attributes.additional_details:
A recent study in the European Journal of Applied Physiology demonstrated that riding a motorcycle on unsurfaced roads two to four times a week reduced blood pressure and body fat. 
These changes reduce the risk of diabetes and cardiovascular disease. 
Research indicates that riders spend an average of £5000 equipping themselves to take up trail riding, estimated 10,000 UK riders equates to £50 million. 
UK trail riders spend approximately £8.5 million per year on consumable items and insurance.

attributes.action: Ban the use of Electric Shock Collars (Also known as E-collars) on Dogs
attributes.background: Electric Shock Collars are worn around a dogs neck and deliver a Electric Shock when the dog does not perform what is asked. These devices are unnecessary and cruel. Besides causing the dogs fear and discomfort they don't teach the dog what is actually desired.
attributes.additional_details:
They are already banned in Wales, so why not the rest of the UK? 

They are used by many who call themselves trainers but don't actually hold any training or behavioural qualifications. Seen as a 'quick fix' many are eager to rush into using one then to work on their dogs issues in a more positive way. 

Out walking i have personally seen many dogs who are on E-collars and due to their 'trainers' advice their owners would never leave home without them. This needs Changing. 

https://www.thekennelclub.org.uk/our-resources/kennel-club-campaigns/electric-shock-collars/

http://randd.defra.gov.uk/Default.aspx?Module=More&Location=None&ProjectID=15332

attributes.action: Ban or reduce the excessive brightness of LED or HID high intensity car lights
attributes.background:
Car head lights are now so bright that it's hard to see driving in the dark because you get blinded by the oncoming cars with high intensity discharge (hid) or led driving lights.
The law needs to be changed to greatly reduce the brightness.

attributes.action: Water safety/drowning prevention & effects of cold water to be taught in schools
attributes.background: In 2016 we saw the launch of the first ever water safety strategy in the UK which aims to reduce water related fatalities by 50% by 2026. Collaboration, awareness, education and prevention are the main focuses.
attributes.additional_details: Like many others i learned the hard way my 1st born son lost his life swimming in open water aged 13. The 1st time I heard the words "cold water shock" was when I was looking up how my physically fit son could have died. I started visiting schools in my son's memory to teach the dangers in & around open water my son was not alone in not knowing the dangers in fact he was part of a majority. This needs to change water safety/ drowning prevention needs to be a part of our national curriculum now!

attributes.action: A new Railway station for Droylsden East
attributes.background: Droylsden East has an extremely busy road between Littlemoss and Droylsden town centre. This road leads to Ashton under lyne and Manchester city centre the other way. With a new school planned for Littlemoss this road will become worse.
attributes.additional_details: The fact this road is also occupied by heavy goods vehicles from Hadfield transport has made this even worse. A Railway station was closed due to the Beeching cuts but the fact the area around Littlemoss has almost doubled justifies the new station. This will help people get to other areas of the country easily and ease congestion on this busy stretch of road.

attributes.action: Require gas products to only be sold to qualified Gas Engineers.
attributes.background: This is important as it would make it nigh on impossible for illegal installers to put the general public in danger, by installing equipment incorrectly. It would allow all installations to be traceable and if a poor/unsafe installation was found it would mean the HSE could actually ACT.
attributes.additional_details: There are around 40 deaths and 200 hospitalisations every year attributed to accidental CO poisoning. The department for health indicate that there are 4,000 attendances at accident and emergency departments for CO poisoning each year in England. This logical step would make all those cases possibly lead to prosecution.

attributes.action: Making false claims about military service should be a criminal offence
attributes.background: There seems to be an occurring theme in professional ex-service members lying or exaggerating their military service to enhance their professional or political career. It should be made a criminal offence to lie about one’s military career for personal gain.

attributes.action: Introduce minimum sentencing for child sexual abuse and online grooming
attributes.background:
We call for 'minimum' sentences and 'open ended' sentencing guidelines to be introduced for child sexual abuse and the offence's related to online child 'grooming'.

We also call for the introduction of laws that keep serial child abusers who re-offend in prison 'indefinitely'.
attributes.additional_details:
We call on the Ministry of Justice to review and reform sentencing laws and guidelines for crimes of child sexual abuse and in particular online grooming of children, and the introduction of 'minimum' sentences. 

Sentencing needs to be appropriate and in accordance with the severity of the crime of sexual grooming of children. Current sentencing guidelines must be reviewed in order to seek justice and to protect the rights of the innocent.

attributes.action: Ban websites from publishing videos that lead children to harm themselves
attributes.background: I lost my 14 year old son Jack Pickles to a craze called “The Choking “Game” / “Passing Out Challenge”. He died because he watched this so-called "game” on the internet and decided to try it. Children don't realise that these videos are often fake or can harm them or worse lead them to their deaths.
attributes.additional_details:
I want to raise awareness of how dangerous these crazy upload fads can be. There are 12+ children I know that have died because of this “Choking Game” / “Passing Out Challenge” more children are getting hurt either though the same craze or other crazy games kids believe are safe.
Hundreds of children have been hurt, scarred for life or suffered life changing injuries because they see people's “Games” and think they can do the same thing because the uploader is ok. We need to keep our children safe

attributes.action: Please grant Michael Holmes a UK Residency Card to remain with his wife Iwona.
attributes.background: I am an American who has lived in the UK for 3 years with my Polish wife who is a NHS staff nurse. We were married in 2015 and known each other 5 years.
attributes.additional_details: I was denied a residency card and it was allowed by appeal. The Home Office retaliated with a section 10 removal notice to deport me. This has now been rescinded but I still don’t know if I will be granted a residency card.

attributes.action: Change the rules to allow gay men to donate blood more freely.
attributes.background: NHS has been crying out for people to donate more blood. Yet as a gay man I cannot do this as easily as others mainly due to the restrictions in place. Having to abstain from sex for 3 months as of 2018 is still not good enough. Gay men want to help save lives too. Help change the rules. Equality.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.blood.co.uk/who-can-give-blood/men-who-have-sex-with-men/

attributes.action: Change the law, so that UK citizens can force an immediate General Election.
attributes.background: At present a vote of no confidence can only be called by parliament, leaving majority governments in an almost untouchable position. This means that governments can break promises at any time.
attributes.additional_details: Citizens should be able to hold the government to account at all times, not just during General Elections. The law needs to be changed so that a petition of 'no confidence' to parliament, containing the signatures of at least 51% of the population means a General Election is immediately called.

attributes.action: Improve allergen labelling on food packaging.
attributes.background:
8% of children and 2% of adults have one or more potentially life threatening food allergies (not intolerances), yet labelling is unclear.
Food should be labelled with:
the front of packaging should have icons to show the type of allergen*. 
The back should list all allergens separately.
attributes.additional_details:
May contains statements are currently optional - leaving people unsure if food is safe. They should be mandatory where there is a genuine risk of cross contamination. Even a small amount of allergen can be fatal.

Currently allergens are made bold in the main ingredients list. Allergy sufferers and their carers have to carefully examine the ingredients to spot them.

Sources:
https://www.anaphylaxis.org.uk/

*Icons for allergens:
http://www.erudus.com/standardised-food-allergy-icons/

attributes.action: Change the NHS 24 week revival rule
attributes.background: Currently doctors and hospital staff are under no legal obligation to help babies born before 24 weeks gestation, even though the youmgest baby to be born and survive was born at just 21 weeks.  Sign to give more babies a chance to survive and live full lives.
attributes.additional_details: 4 years ago my son was born at 20 weeks gestation, he was born alive and fought for his life for 2 hours before taking his last breath, he was given absolutley no medical help, and was just left in a cot to die because of this rule. I'm sure there are many more cases like mine, and there shouldnt be any more! The bottom line of a hospitals job is to keep people alive when they enter it that way, and premature babies are no different, if they are born alive they should be helped to stay alive!

attributes.action: Pass law requiring sponsors pay index-linked annual increases for DB pensioners
attributes.background: All company pensions should have annual index-linked increase, including those for pensioners that earned their benefits prior to 1997. This will not apply retrospectively but will ensure that in future all benefits earned during the working life of the pensioner are protected against inflation.
attributes.additional_details: In 1997 the Government passed a law that required index-linked annual pension increases on Defined Benefit (DB) pension sponsors. However pre 1997 service was excluded. There are some 100,000 pensioners who fall into this category. A fair solution would require relatively small amount of money. Many of the companies concerned took pension contribution holidays and benefited accordingly, have hidden behind the law and do not pay increments.It is not expected that increases should be retrospective

attributes.action: Abolish the subsidy on food and drink in the Palace of Westminster restaurants.
attributes.background: In 2016, the food subsidy in Parliament cost taxpayers around £3.7 million. This use of taxpayers’ money must stop and the funds diverted to public services where it is needed. MPs earn significant wages and citizens who themselves struggle to buy food should not be forced to help feed MPs as well.

attributes.action: Allow Students Who Are Estranged From Family To Claim Housing Benefit In Summer
attributes.background: Students are not permitted to access Housing Benefit. But 'estranged students', whose relationship with their parents has broken down, and who are not leaving care, are not given any financial maintenance for the 10-week summer break. Thousands of students face homelessness over summer as a result.
attributes.additional_details: Student maintenance loans are calculated to cover the costs of studying during term time, assuming a level of family support over the holidays. In England And Wales, there are around 9,000 estranged students, who don’t have parental support and who aren’t care leavers. Research shows these students struggle with homelessness over the summer break. The government should lift restrictions, allowing students without parental or local authority support to receive housing benefit over summer.

attributes.action: Abolish the Solicitors Regulation Authority
attributes.background: We already have the Legal Ombudsman to protect the Public Interest. The Police and Fraud action cover any crimes. The fees generated by the SRA should be paid to the Government to set up an independent, fair and balanced body.
attributes.additional_details: A group of solicitors are now forming an action group as there is a real concern smaller firms may be being targeted by insurance giants who may be using the SRA to ensnare the smaller firms in tangles of red tape that handicap their ability to represent the general public against the insurance giants. This risks preventing access to justice for the public who can’t afford to pay a bigger law firm.

attributes.action: Help fund the cost of redistributing more edible surplus food to charity.
attributes.background: It can cost up to £150 per tonne to separate, store and transport edible surplus food to charity. If this cost were reimbursed far more of the 270,000 tonnes of edible surplus in the system would go to people who need it. For only £10-15m per year, 100,000 tonnes of food could be donated to charity.
attributes.additional_details:
This funding could save UK charities millions. If only 100,000 tonnes of surplus was redistributed it could save them between £150-200m - at least a tenfold return. 
At current levels of redistribution it would only cost £2.6m per year.
If we are wrong and this doesn't increase, the cost doesn't go up. If we are right, every pound will result in exponential benefit to charity.
This is great value, potentially hugely effective and risk free.
To read more go to thegrocer.co.uk/wastenotwantnot

attributes.action: Urge Israel to stop the deportation of African refugees to third countries.
attributes.background:
Dear Friends,
We are alarmed by the Israeli Government’s plan of deportation; if not reversed the refugees could face abductions, enslavement, torture, and death trying to reach Europe.

We urge you to sign this petition. 
Committee of Eritrean Unity for Justice – UK.
attributes.additional_details:
We are urging the UK Government to use its diplomatic clout to persuade the Israeli Government to stop deporting, the refugees and provide them protection under the UN Convention Article 33 (1) “No Contracting State shall expel or return a refugee in any manner whatsoever [...]”

Further detail see the link below https://storage.googleapis.com/wzukusers/user-28803632/documents/5a724e7fdb1ffzxNoqTu/Petition%20to%20stop%20the%20illegal%20deportation%20of%20African%20Refugees%20in%20Israel.pdf

attributes.action: Make statutory adoption leave and pay available for the self employed.
attributes.background: Statutory adoption pay and leave is not available to those who are self employed however statutory maternity leave and pay is. This is discriminatory against those willing and wanting to give the best start to an adopted child by being at home to nurture, care and develop a bond with their child.
attributes.additional_details:
A self employed parent who can biologically have a child can receive statutory maternity leave and pay. If for whatever reason they have chosen to adopt a child this self employed parent has no rights to adoption pay and leave.

By leaving self employed adoptive parents to self fund and not work over this leave, it places another barrier to the adoption process.

A prospective adopter will have a strengthened application if they can show how one parent can commit to adoption leave.

attributes.action: Introduce a nationwide deposit return system for plastic bottles in the UK
attributes.background: We call for the UK-wide introduction of a deposit return scheme for drinks bottles and cans. While Scotland is planning such a scheme, the rest of the country must not fall behind. Given the near-ubiquitous plastic pollution of oceans and land environments, urgent action is required by the whole UK.
attributes.additional_details: Worldwide, 8 million tonnes of plastic leaks into the oceans annually, where it fragments into ever-smaller particles. According to scientific studies, it can now be found in the guts of 90% of seabirds, in 1/3 of UK-caught fish, and even in tap water. Urgent action is needed. Of the 35 million plastic bottles discarded daily by British households, almost half do not get recycled. Many countries already have deposit return schemes. In the German one, over 97% of PET plastic bottles get recycled.

attributes.action: Make Food and Farming education in UK schools part of the curriculum
attributes.background: Children and young people are becoming more disconnected than ever from where their food comes from or how it is produced. Is it right that out of 27,500 children 1/3 thought cheese was made from plants? Additionally, 1/4 thought fish fingers were made from chicken or pork. (BBC News, 2013).
attributes.additional_details: Food production represents the single largest human use of land. Why is food production not part of the curriculum? The increasing influence of social media can lead to dramatic lifestyle changes and criticism, often based on myths surrounding farming practices and confusion with those which happen outside of the UK. Informed choices can only be made if food and farming education becomes part of the curriculum in all UK schools in order to deliver unbiased facts to children and young adults.

attributes.action: The Government MUST NOT let the ECJ override British justice after Brexit
attributes.background: Theresa May is considering giving the ECJ a role in Britain once it has left the EU. She held talks on a referral system for European citizens who remain in the UK. Judges in the UK would refer cases to Luxembourg should queries crop up that have not been addressed during Britain's membership.

attributes.action: Revise current Care Order categories for adoption breakdowns.
attributes.background: Often adoption disruptions take place due to factors outside of the adopter’s control, such as previous trauma that the child has experienced and the lack of support that is available to adopters. Adoption disruptions rarely take place due to a lack of love or because the adopter is abusive.
attributes.additional_details:
In order for the local authority to gain parental responsibility of a child (whether from adopters or birth parents) they must evidence that the child is/ or likely to suffer significant harm due to either emotional, sexual, physical, neglect or mental abuse. 

If an adoption disrupts due to no fault of the parents or child, this does not fall into any of the above categories of abuse yet the social worker must still pick one. Therefore the current system is unfit for purpose.

attributes.action: Continue to recognise and allow the Inbound European Au Pair program post Brexit
attributes.background: We, the undersigned and BAPAA, are greatly concerned that the UK government has not prioritised the importance of Au Pairs to the British economy during the Brexit negotiations.  Our formal representations to government ministers have been ignored and yet Au Pairs are vital to the British economy.
attributes.additional_details: Thousands of hard-working parents rely on European Au pairs to enable them to juggle their work life balance.  Au Pairs receive pocket money and live as part of a family to experience British culture and family life and to learn English. This affordable program provides UK families with flexible childcare and enables young Europeans to study English and be introduced to British values at no cost to our government.  Brexit must ensure the continuation of this valuable cultural exchange programme.

attributes.action: Government must publish a Carers' Strategy and not a Carers’ Action Plan
attributes.background: I am one of the 7 million unpaid carers in the country. You can read about me here http://bit.ly/2lGLpxc (Guardian web link) I took part in a government consultation for unpaid carers in early 2016. Carers have been waiting for a Government Strategy ever since.  I know unpaid carers deserve better.
attributes.additional_details: Like 6,500 other carers, I spent time providing evidence for government on our caring role. It was expected that government would publish the results in a Carers Strategy by the end of 2016. Nothing has happened since the consultation closed. In October 2017, I was quoted in a debate in Parliament https://goo.gl/vN27L2 (Parliament web link). An Action Plan was recently mentioned but an Action Plan is not a Carers' Strategy. Signing this petition will show government that carers matter.

attributes.action: To legalise handguns for fac holders
attributes.background: I believe that legitimate gun owners should be able to shoot a handgun because Northern Ireland do and so does the Isle of Man and jersey. You can say guns will increase violent crime but Switzerland has 1 gun per 2 people and have a lower crime rate than us. Fac holders should be able to do this to
attributes.additional_details: This will mean fac holders can own handguns for target shooting and self defence like Northern Ireland

attributes.action: Independent review of appointments to Office of Students board
attributes.background: The OfS has responsibility for putting “the student interest at heart” and promoting fair access to HE. Therefore we request an independent review of the appointment process to the board to assure it has been transparent, recruited the best qualified & meets public duties under the Equalities Act.
attributes.additional_details: Given the importance of Higher Education to a prosperous and democratic society, it is important that it is appropriately regulated. This requires a board that understands the sector and is committed to furthering the pursuit of knowledge across all disciplines and for the support of all members of society. Expertise should be drawn from outside and from within the sector. The exclusion of academic and professional services representatives and of a member of the NUS is of particular concern.

attributes.action: Reduce the foreign aid budget and increase police funding from the savings.
attributes.background: The government proposes increases in council tax to raise £450m extra funding for the police.  Sign this petition if you want the government to reduce foreign aid to cover this cost rather than to further increase our taxes.
attributes.additional_details: In compliance with UN guidelines, the government spends 0.7% per annum on foreign aid, which equated to approximately £12bn in 2015.  Much of this goes toward slush funds and dubious projects in which we, the taxpayer, currently have no say.   This is our money, thus we demand a say.

attributes.action: Schools to have mental health and disabilities a part of the curriculum
attributes.background: For ages I have and many others I know, have said that learning about health issues and disabilities should be part of the curriculum taught in schools. It could help limit if not stop the stigma and bullying.

attributes.action: The government should introduce a truly FAIR funding formula for all schools.
attributes.background: The current funding of schools is unfairly distributed meaning that some schools receive millions of pounds more than others.  A "fair" funding formula was to be introduced for schools but this was dropped, leaving many schools underfunded due to lower real terms funding (i.e. due to inflation etc).
attributes.additional_details:
Some additional funding was given recently but is outweighed by inflationary pressures (increased costs) and additional government requirements.  Schools in some areas are either having to make redundancies or are using up remaining cash reserves.  This is therefore a looming crisis that the government must address before this impacts further on outcomes.

All references to funding made above are "per pupil" and take account of separate funding such as the pupil premium and London weighting.

attributes.action: Fund Slow Down For Horses and Horse Awareness Adverts on Television
attributes.background: We see adverts warning drivers of the dangers of speeding. A horse is a live animal, unpredictable in most surroundings and traffic. We need adverts to highlight this with stories and evidence to hit home. Horse riding has become more popular which is resulting in more accidents and even deaths.

attributes.action: End homelessness in Britain by adopting and funding the "Housing First" project.
attributes.background: There are over 9000 homeless people living on the streets of Britain. Many are ex military men and women suffering from mental health issues. No one chooses to be homeless. Britain can and should eradicate homelessness. The "Housing First" model has already proven to reduce homelessness in Europe.
attributes.additional_details: Finland adopted the "Housing First" model in 2008. To date Finland is the only European country to see homelessness numbers falling. The model is simple: Provide a home first, treat the causes of homelessness and help people to retrain and get back into work and reintegrate into society. Not only is "Housing First" cost effective but it is morally the "right thing to do". Many MP's already support "Housing First". By supporting this petition you could force a parliamentary debate.

attributes.action: A Bomber Command Campaign Medal honouring those who served
attributes.background: My Great Uncle lost his life as a pathfinder during WW2, we have no campaign medical for them; we had to raise the money for a memorial to those who served. It is disgusting that their efforts have NEVER been recognised.
attributes.additional_details:
Bomber Command Memorial Group, Bomber Command History Forum. 
Wilfred Cyril Riches RAF (V) DFC & bar pathfinder killed on ops 5/6th July 1944

attributes.action: Immediately boost NHS funding by around £5bn a year from adding 1p to Income Tax
attributes.background: When my own 3-year-old broke his leg, the hospital said he needed a wheelchair but they could no longer afford them. Our 8-year-old son had to join a two year waiting list for an autism assessment. For the sake of all children in the UK, the NHS urgently needs more funding.
attributes.additional_details: It’s a policy that has previously been put forward by the Liberal Democrats, and was backed by a group of senior health professionals at the time including Sir David Nicholson, who led NHS England for almost a decade, and the previous heads of the Royal College of General Practitioners and also the Royal College of Psychiatrists.

attributes.action: Reinstate sailing and windsurfing to A level and GCSE PE
attributes.background: Recently sailing and windsurfing have been taken off the list of sports you can be marked on for GCSE and A level PE. Some people started this course unaware of this change.
attributes.additional_details: Sailing and Windsurfing should be reinstated as you have to be physically fit to compete, you can race and it involves refining technique to do well. The UK is an island which mean there are plenty of places for young people to participate in these activities.

attributes.action: Regulate the eyelash extension industry making training compulsory
attributes.background: Let’s make our lash industry safe, by regulating it we avoid non trained individuals to practice without a license. This would minimise the risks of lash and eye damage

attributes.action: End entirely the BBC's self-regulating complaints procedure.
attributes.background: The BBC is currently in charge of it own complaints procedure. Only after three phases can a complaint be referred to Ofcom. I have, on multiple occasions, complained about BBC content from television and radio and not once has my complaint been upheld.
attributes.additional_details: I have requested statistical details of how many complaints are given rulings in favour of the complainant and no information has been provided. The BBC should not be able to self-regulate in this way. It is funded by the TV Licence fee and the tax payer and should therefore be accountable to its audience. The BBC should not be self-regulating and all complaints should be made directly to Ofcom. Ofcom should provide a comprehensive response to the complainant and full statistical transparency.

attributes.action: Right to remain for 18+ who have lived in the country since they were minors
attributes.background: Grant the right to remain in the UK and Republic of Northern Ireland to 18+ Immigrants currently without legal status to remain in the country, who have lived in the country as minors, completed their A level qualifications and are now unable to progress further into Higher Education.
attributes.additional_details: There are many brilliant, gifted, intelligent, responsible and upstanding 18+ in the country that are unable to progress further into higher education and/or employment because the lack of a legal status limits them. Haven been shown concern by the government until they legally became adults (i.e. Bus pass and free education), it is such let down to these young adults who (without having a say in being brought to the UK or Northern Ireland) now often find it almost impossible to move on in life

attributes.action: Exclude drone 'freestyle/racer' pilots from future drone usage restrictions.
attributes.background: The many 'near miss' drone incidents reported in the media involve drones requiring little skill to fly and piloted by inexperienced individuals. Restrictions would unfairly affect pilots of 'freestyle/racer' drones, which haven't been involved in such an incident to date.
attributes.additional_details:
